## Results

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
countries <- read.csv("country_profile_variables.csv")
countries1 <- countries[!(countries$Fertility.rate..total..live.births.per.woman. < 0 | 
                            countries$GDP.per.capita..current.US.. <0),]
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = countries1, mapping = aes(x = GDP.per.capita..current.US.., 
                                       y = as.numeric(Fertility.rate..total..live.births.per.woman.))) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth() +
  labs(
    x = "GDP per Capita (in USD)",
    y = "Fertility Rate (Total Live Births per Woman)",
    title = "Fertility Rates by GDP for Countries in 2017"
  )
```

```{r}
fit1 <- lm(as.numeric(Fertility.rate..total..live.births.per.woman.) ~ GDP.per.capita..current.US.., data = countries1)
summary(fit1)

library(modelsummary)

modelsummary(list(fit1), coef_rename = c("Intercept", "GDP per Capita (USD)"))
```
